title: when your team tells you to kill yourself
body:
When your whole team tells you to kill yourself how to you respond?
This happened to me in a game and I just stop helping them passing the time split pushing and reading toxic comments from my team I tried my best but I still got suspended.
What am I suppose to do when someone wants you to kill yourself do you ignore it and help them? 
Why does the victim have to be punish but the offenders  get off free?

replies.body: Laugh that a bunch of kids playing the same game for the same reason as you are acting soo immature. Mute them.

The generic response is just mute them, and then report them after, but what really needs to happen is Riot needs to bring back the Tribunal.  The automated punishment system isn't effective enough on it's own, it lets many truly hateful people off with no punishment.

Tribunal was worse at that... especially because it was working slow as hell.
The only thing that Tribunal had over the current system is the visbility and transparency of punishment occuring.
Is the current automated system any better?

Here's how the current system works:
1. Reports come in and are evaluated mostly automatically.
2. Enough "bad" games have been collected and the target is punished.

Here's how Tribunal used to work:
1. Reports come in and are somewhat evaluated regarding report weight.
2. Enough reports have been collected and the target gets into Tribunal.
3. Enough people have voted on the case.
4. (Might be already done with #3) The tendency towards punish is clear enough for punishment to occur.
5. If it's a permaban still manually check it before issuing it

I simply cannot imagine how the current system could possibly be any slower, given that it skips certain steps alltogether.

And the leniency... well... it's difficult to tell now, but it was difficult to tell back then as well. Tribunal had an amazing transparency when it came to false positives, but you could still only see the false negatives of cases that made it to Tribunal in the first place.

I screenshot it, report all of them, send in a support ticket, and then wait to see if Riot will really permaban others for sending death threats.

I know, I'm a killjoy at parties.
Obviously they are just telling you to bait/feed the opposing team!  Also neutral camps can kill you as well.  People should be careful of what they wish for in a game.

I don't respond at all. I simply mute people like that. They're not worth getting upset over. They're also not worth losing a game for, so yes, I'll still help them.

Why should I punish myself because somebody else is being an asshole?

Honestly I'd say if they are saying stuff like that then they are the ones with the issue. Always be nice to them no matter what or at least try to ignore it. Use mute if you have to.

Most people have an innate issue with dealing with things they cant directly control, like other people. The best way to change their view on you is to show them how they should be acting by example. 

Or, if you dont care at all about that, which is fair, then mute them and report them after the game. If you choose this route dont say anything to or about them, just play the game and leave a detailed report.
If you got punish but not them, i guess you were a lot worse.
I didn't say anything too them all game till like 30 mins
mute button 2 hard 2 find it seems

boo fucking hoo. but if internet words hurt you there's your safe space with the mute button.

i'm not an asshole in game but if someone flames me I either laugh or just ignore it

you should try that too
